website_summaries.verdict: The Plustek ePhoto Z300 is a low-priced sheet-feed scanner that's best for household use such as digitizing snapshots.
pros: Fast photo scanning compared with flatbed models
Designed to minimize potential harm to photos

customer_reviews.title: Fast, quiet and great quality of image.
customer_reviews.text: A fast, quiet and efficient upright slightly tilting back scanner. Buyers might like to note that the scanning bar does tilt backwards and away from scanning plane thus allows the simple removal of the packaging materials. If you don’t do this you first few scans might not work due to packaging jam. It’s not mentioned in the quick start guide. Worth knowing though.
customer_reviews.author: Jim DeGriz

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant, easy and quick scanner
customer_reviews.text: What a fantastic bit of kit. I downloaded the software first then plugged it in. Worked straight away. It is so easy to use. Scans a picture in 2 seconds. If you have a particular picture you want to get the best, you can increase the DPI to 600 but that takes about 6 seconds. I used the 600 setting for proper old pictures but normal colour ones were perfect at 300 DPI (2seconds). I spent a few hours over a couple of days and scanned over 2000 pictures. It was actually very satisfying and now I have all my pictures digitised and in relevant folders. A little bit expensive but a fantastic bit of kit
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: It's a brilliant photo scanner that's far quicker than a flatbed, at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: Does a good job of digitising all my old photos. Very quick. Software a bit difficult to master in setting your target folder, but that will improve with practice. Really excellent one touch improvement of old wishy-washy faded colour photos. Be aware that once you have saved the scans to your destination folder you can no longer use the built-in touch-up software, although you may have other s/w on your computer that will do a similar job.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Good Photo Scanner
customer_reviews.text: Had a quick play with this and the results look very promising. Certainly quick enough scanning at 300dpi and couldn't detect much difference in quality on the slower 600dpi with a basic 6x4 film "snap" photo. Software supplied on CD isn't too bad and fairly easy to get the hang of so be able to rattle through those boxes of old photo's pretty quickly with this !
customer_reviews.author: Steve K

customer_reviews.title: Nonexistent customer support.
customer_reviews.text: This is potentially a good product but I have an issue with getting it to scan in 600dpi and despite 3 separate attempts to get a response from Plustek customer support I have so far been met with a deafening silence. It worry what they (Plustek) will be like for product support further down the line when they cannot bring themselves to respond to a simple question, one day after purchase. I will avoid this company like the plague in future. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: DaveG

customer_reviews.title: Decent if it works...
customer_reviews.text: Fast. Decent output. However, this is my third one. The first one, had a line through all the photos I had scanned. The second one, was slow. Third one - which I am returning again, has the same issue as the first one. I actually think its the same one as some of the plastic was missing!!
customer_reviews.author: Addicted

customer_reviews.title: Best Photo Scanning Experience
customer_reviews.text: I finally decided to archive all the photos we have taken over the years and was using a flatbed scanner. This did a good job but was time consuming. 50 Photos would take just over an hour and I estimated that I had about 20000 photos on paper, at three hours a week this would take about 133 week or 5 years to do! When this dawned on me I wanted a better solution. This scanner was it. 50 photos now take 5 minutes! It straightens the photos and balances the colours. The scans are a better quality than my flatbed and I actually enjoy the process. I cannot recommend this photo scanner enough!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. C. Haygarth

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use aand good image for the resolution.
customer_reviews.text: I did not find it the easiest to set up but got quick and good help from Plustek.to get it to work. In operation It is easy to use. and produces a good resul for the resolution. I idid about 15 images before filing them in a photo folder. It filed them on my Pc in filepath: This PC/Users/Public/Pictures/PlustekPhoto/Then a uniques date /no for each photo.
customer_reviews.author: MOSTON LAD

customer_reviews.title: Fast and easy to digitise your photos
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to digitise a lot of historic photos and unlock them from shoe boxes ! While this looked expensive it works really well, saved me a laborious process of scanning with a desktop scanner and made me smile looking back at old photos and sharing them back with family members. Quality is good, and the auto-alignment and cropping made this really easy. Certainly one of my best purchases and if you have a lot of old photos it's certainly worth the investment as it has saved so much time. I got through boes of photos in less than 1/10th of the time !! Good purchase (and I normally don't submit reviews !)
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Alan Southall

customer_reviews.title: Amazing piece of kit and so easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Decided to finally scan in all my old hard copy photos during lock down. Scanner is compact and easy to set up. Plug it in, install the software from the disk (I use windows) and start scanning. Takes all size photos as long as A4 or smaller, drop them through the slot and it takes about 2 seconds a photos. Software is simple - once you have scanned them, press save and it asks you where on your pc you want to save them. Couldn't be simpler, I am delighted with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: MrsF

customer_reviews.title: At last a scanner for photos
customer_reviews.text: If like me you have literally thousands of old photos collecting dust and you need to store them digitally - this machine although pricey - is the answer. Flatbed scanners are fine for a few but when you talk thousands this is the device. You simply drop each print in the top - even if they go in skew the software straightens them - and 300 dpi is indeed very fast 600dpi slower as you would expect but still very acceptable. A good buy.
customer_reviews.author: DJT

customer_reviews.title: Installation
customer_reviews.text: Great on laptop - wouldn't install on desktop. Installshield error "you are have not enough space" incorrect. Amber light on device - not blue. Tracked down to running .exe files problem. Solution: From Command prompt (as administrator) run DISM.exe /Online /Cleanup-image /Restorehealth Takes a few minutes (progress shown as % done) Knocked a couple of stars off the Easy to Install to highlight problem, probably a unfair, because it was a machine problem.
customer_reviews.author: Mr B

customer_reviews.title: Really delighted!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely delighted with this - easy to use and so quick! Am whizzing through decades of old photos that I have been meaning to back up for years. Cannot really comment on how the quality compares with other, more expensive scanners but this is such good value for money that I would really recommend it to anyone who wants to ensure that they have copies of precious memories - not just photos but notes, letters, leaflets and cards -anything that you want to keep a copy of really!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy to use and well made.
customer_reviews.text: Where has this been all my life, when I think of the hours I have wasted with my old scanner! This is a fantastic piece of kit, very very easy to install and use. The photos fly through giving fantastic images to work with. I scan them onto my computer then I transfer them to my iPhoto file and edit them. I can’t tell you how quick and easy this is to use and would highly recommend it. It is a little pricey but worth every penny when you have a lifetime of photos that you want to save.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Buttall

customer_reviews.title: Amazing scanner for the variety of photo sizes it can scan.
customer_reviews.text: Blown away by the versaility of the scanner, from old passport photos to A4, the scanning process is fast, easy and flawless. The software automatically rotates any photo that didn't go in straight. My wife has been able to whizz through the old shoe boxes of photos and can do around 100 in 15 minutes. Quality of the scans is great as well. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Norbert's Treasure Trove

customer_reviews.title: Great & fast photo scanner
customer_reviews.text: I bought this purely to digitise 2 drawers full of photos. its did the job perfectly. what i thought was going to be a 1 week job took 1 long day. its amazingly fast. the colour reproduction was not perfect but very good considering the speed it processed the photos. i use the scanner for day to day work now as its great. i would highly recommend this product. My only criticism is that the software looks a bit out of date now, but functions perfectly well.
customer_reviews.author: N. pattison

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Great quality in standard mode and very quick to use. Software is excellent even if the photo goes into the machine at a crooked angle. It automatically crops and straightens. I found dropping rather than placing photos into the machine prevented scanning 'false starts'. Most of the issues raised by other reviewers are prevented if you follow instructions and use the calibration sheet provided.
customer_reviews.author: Bluehorizon

customer_reviews.title: Quality way to digitise old memories
customer_reviews.text: Amazing little thing ... after getting the setup wrong ( and not scanning the config card and just scanning a normal photo... and then wondering why all the photos were coming out odd) ... I managed to do it properly and I must say the quality is stunning, so easy and quick to scan and it even improves the images once scanned... Great stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas C.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Scanner for large numbers of photos
customer_reviews.text: Well designed feed, and clever software, makes this device useful for scanning large numbers of photos. We managed to scan 1500 family photos in 40 minutes. The software crops all images into perfect jpegs and places, names them logically, and places them neatly into a folder. Fantastic and great value.
customer_reviews.author: Colin JONES

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: This scanner does the job well. In lockdown I decided to do a job I had planned ages ago, namely scan and share old photos. This little scanner does the job nicely. The 50 scan per session before saving is no big hassle. The 300dpi scans are super quick. 600dpi takes quite a while but maybe useful for a few photos. I managed to wade through piles of family albums in a couple of days. The ephoto software is easy to use, although I'd prefer to touch up photos with Photoshop if needed.
customer_reviews.author: A M B

customer_reviews.title: A most excellent photo scanner
customer_reviews.text: I bought this device in order to scan hundreds of photographs that have been collected over many years. The machine was extremely easy to setup and calibrate. A test scan worked perfectly and the copied image produced excellent colour match. Highly delighted with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It really is quick if you have a batch of snaps to scan
customer_reviews.text: Good for rapid scanning of old photos - saved a LOT of time. I haven’t tried any of the fancier features yet. Colour balance is ok mostly on the swift scan, occasional tweaking required. I guess it could be a little cheaper for what it does, but there is not much competition out there at the basic end of the market.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Super fast and super colour rendering
customer_reviews.text: This is a really great scanner; not only is is really fast - less than 2 seconds for a 6x4 print - but great definition and clour rendering. It has a higher definition mode as well, and will scan A4 documents in seconds. Very easy to use, it is truly brilliant.
customer_reviews.author: Hopeneverdies

customer_reviews.title: Poor software and scanner leaves white line on an image
customer_reviews.text: Poor software and scanner leaves white line on an image if you insert photo slightly off centre. Not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: keistoq

customer_reviews.title: Scanner
customer_reviews.text: This scanner is a great addition to our electronics. It is very easy to use and the colour reproduction is excellent. It is small and unobtrusive but pack a might punch, would recommend anyone thinking about getting one to go ahead and do it.
customer_reviews.author: Bongo

customer_reviews.title: This scanner is very quick
customer_reviews.text: I bought the scanner to scan the hundreds of old photos I had not yet scanned and it has worked very well speed wise. I would have liked the scan to produce a larger file than the 600 dpi that it does but as I have no intention of printing the photos it is not a problem. The software is not as user friendly as it could be but once you get used to it it works fine. Overall I have been more than satisfied with the scanner.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent scanner
customer_reviews.text: I was able to rip through scanning my old photos, even on the highest quality setting. There were a few that I had to re-scan but that's to be expected I guess. I really liked the feature that automatically positioned the pic to look level even when I put it in a bit angled. The colour of the scans were good as well. Overall, I am really happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Howard J Wild

customer_reviews.title: Really fast scanner let down by the software
customer_reviews.text: Great scanner, copes well with wonky fed pictures which are immediatly straightened but the software crashes every 50ish scans & has to be restarted. Its easy enough to restart the program but it shouldnt happen!
customer_reviews.author: EW

customer_reviews.title: VERY simple to use
customer_reviews.text: You might need to download the latest software but its on line and easy to find. Once set up it could not be easier to use. I was scanning old photos and you feed them in at the top, at the lower quality I could just keep up. At the higher setting they take a bit longer, about 5-6 seconds. The scan quality, certainty for old photos is great. You can feed anything in from small b&w photos to A4 colour Docs and it will save them automatically trimmed to the right size and correct colour format.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor B.

customer_reviews.title: Superb piece of kit!
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up, DOES work well with Mac OS, amazingly quick scanning and has already paid for itself as I have hundreds of photos and companies wanted £1 per photo to scan. This piece of kit is fantastic value for Money. You can edit within the software itself or do it later in other Photos apps. AND it scans up to A4 documents. Best thing I’ve bought for ages.
customer_reviews.author: maurice

customer_reviews.title: What a life saver!
customer_reviews.text: What a fantastic product. I have about 2000 photos to scan, and I was dreading it. With this device, you just slot the photos through quickly one after the other - they don't even have to be correctly aligned - and the device does everything for you. Fabulous!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: So easy to use, currently scanning thousands of old photos, love that I can also scan letters, receipts and newspaper cuttings in PDF too It scans 50 images at a time before you need to save them to a file on your laptop. I like the editing tool too, it sharpen up an old black &white photo really nicely.
customer_reviews.author: carolynes1

customer_reviews.title: Get those photos scanned easily and quickly
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant scanner for all those photos and paperwork. No ore lifting the lid up and down, just sheet feed up to 60 photos a time. Great quality, easy to set up and use. I was able to scan over 3000 photos over a 3 day period and put online for posterity. Well worth the money and to get those photos that are stored away out in the open for family to see.
customer_reviews.author: Alibongo67

customer_reviews.title: Best photo scanner I’ve used
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant scanner - I’ve been through hundreds of photos in a few hours. It’s easy to use, software for Mac is downloadable and works perfectly, and even the editing suite is great. Worth the money over a flatbed scanner!
customer_reviews.author: Narwhal

customer_reviews.title: Excellent. Does what it says on the tin!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent bit of kit. Have scanned arooubd 1000 photo prints so far. Does exactly what I want. Pop the photo in, it travels through automatically ( just like a laminator) and appears on my pc. Can’t see the difference between 300dpi and 600dpi so I stick with the 300dpi and it scans so fast. Can do 50 at a time, then you need to save them into a file, where you can edit them using windows which I found very easy. Can’t praise it enough.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher K. Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Just the job!
customer_reviews.text: I love this scanner! I have a lot of magazines that only have a few articles I want to keep. I couldn't be bothered scanning them all on my flatbed scanner. This scanner is just the job - it scans magazine pages quickly and easily and the resolution of the scan is briliant. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Moiz

customer_reviews.title: Great Gadget
customer_reviews.text: Just received this today and have already scanned a load of photos. Think I'd reiterate what others have said. The hardware seems great and fairly solid. However, the software really has a rather 'old' clunky feel to it that I'd expect to see on WIndows 3.1 not windows 10!!! It works, it's just clumsy and not very strealimed at all. Save features are not straightforward either. Otherwise, it would have had 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Mandy Smith

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup and use
customer_reviews.text: Using on a Mac (download the latest version from the manufacturer website), easy to setup and use. Scans a 6*4 picture in a few seconds and an A4 document in a couple of seconds longer
customer_reviews.author: T. Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Just perfect for what i looking for
customer_reviews.text: A perfect quick scanner for photos and documents. Easy to install, use. The only problem is the resolution doesn't go further than 600. But I am very happy and already have scanned loads of photos.
customer_reviews.author: shida mohammadi

customer_reviews.title: Good scanner
customer_reviews.text: I downloaded the latest software and installed this before using the scanner for the first time. It calibrated easily and produced good quality photos and documents.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Easy to set up, compact, very easy to use and so quick. Also the ability to edit photos. I have thousands of photos in albums that I am scanning.
customer_reviews.author: Charl1966

customer_reviews.title: Easy and does the job
customer_reviews.text: I never write reviews normally, but the Plustek Photo Scanner is so easy to use, fast and automatically adjusts the photos. I had previously used a flat bed scanner for photos but that was laborious in comparison. It also scans documents. So glad I bought this, not only time saving but a delight to use.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs M Burton

customer_reviews.title: Good value for money
customer_reviews.text: This is a great piece of kit for the money. It is very quick to scan documents and when I contacted the company they answered swiftly, helpfully and got it sorted. Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Papasmurph

customer_reviews.title: No good for me
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t work with an IPad so no good for me.
customer_reviews.author: Graham Rouse

customer_reviews.title: Nice little scanner.
customer_reviews.text: Quick in scanning the few thousand photos I have. Only took a few nights (until I went to bed) for me to complete. Good quality scans. Well good enough for me.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Timo

customer_reviews.title: Really happy with this scanner
customer_reviews.text: I bought a couple of scanners to digitalise my photo library, and neither of them worked with my Mac. This one, I literally plugged it in, ran a calibration sheet, and it was all set up! It's so easy to use that even my 4 year old has been helping me with the scanning. I'm really happy with it, and would 100% recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Morris

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Great value.
customer_reviews.text: What a great find this is. Scans photos one at a time, of various sizes and shapes and the software allows manipulation before filing in a location of choice. Really useful when scanning a quantity of old photos. Great value and worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Malcolm

customer_reviews.title: Fast and good
customer_reviews.text: The scanner solved a problem by allowing rapid scanning of photograph albums for a family event
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Quick and Easy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to archive my parents massive photo collection and it’s a godsend. Was apprehensive to buy it due to the price and unknown brand, but it’s turned out to be great. Quick and easy. Scan 50 photos at a time then choose where to store them. Simple as that. You have to feed the prints one at a time which is the only hardship, otherwise great.
customer_reviews.author: Pete Linehan

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t get simpler than this.
customer_reviews.text: Great and simple piece of kit if you e got loads of old photos. Will scan up to 50 photos at a time which you manually load. Each photo takes a couple of seconds and that’s it. Couldn't be simpler. Only gripe is that the software installation is slow and lumpy- I thought it had failed at least twice but it plodded on. Take around 40 minutes to install.
customer_reviews.author: Larkin

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use - I use it for scanning pictures and documents, simply drop the photo through and it gets scanned. I scan on 300dpi and it takes about 2 secs to scan each pic - perfect for digitising all those old family photos
customer_reviews.author: Mal

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely brilliant. Wish I had found it sooner
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this! Wish I had found it sooner. The photograph is in and out before I even have time to get another one out of the album. Before it used to take me about 6 minutes to scan a photo and save it and now it takes seconds. Brilliant! I wish it hadn’t been quite as expensive but then again it’s proved to be brilliant
customer_reviews.author: Alyson Blush

customer_reviews.title: Looks good poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Yrief to scan photos and ot left a white line down centre of picture sent item back for refund
customer_reviews.author: Robbo

customer_reviews.title: Great photo scanner
customer_reviews.text: great scanner scanned hundreds of photo and it really scan very quick love it
customer_reviews.author: Grecho

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: Very good, speed of copying good, setting up easy If you've got lot of photos to scan worth buying
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, could be cheaper.
customer_reviews.text: Works well, very quick 300dpi scanning ( 600dpi takes longer). Just wish it had an automatic feeder. Scanned about 3000 photos!
customer_reviews.author: pzyorks

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: Quick scanning with good results. I'm very pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jaishin Thejopal

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for digitisng family snaps
customer_reviews.text: The scanner is very easy to use and flexible in the size and shape of photos it takes. The software strikes the right balance between simplicity of use and facilities. It is pricey but well worth it to hold on to all those photos before phone cameras were invented!
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up
customer_reviews.text: Only downside is it does not come with a sleeve
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Great Bit Of Kit
customer_reviews.text: What a fantastic bit of kit. Does exactly what it says and was just what I was looking for. Would highly recommend to anyone looking to scan and keep there old photos. Great job, well happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Mr N.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic, Brilliant & Superb
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic, scanned more than 2,000 old photographs over three afternoons, can't praise it enough, everything was easy to use and worked first time and every time. Would recommend this to anyone who needs to bulk scan photos.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great little scanner found it so simple to use and ...
customer_reviews.text: great little scanner found it so simple to use and to set up have scanned a load of my old photos in half the time it would have to with flatbed scanner nice size for your desk
customer_reviews.author: djam490

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Great, tech has arrived to encourage me to scan those old family black and white pics. Shared online with the whole family. Just 2 resolution 300& 600, use 600. A few seconds to scan. Just feed it in. It then appears on your PC. I recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Tony whitehead

customer_reviews.title: Quality, speed
customer_reviews.text: Does a great job - exactly as it said. Quality copies of photos - all done quickly - saves hours of you have a lot of photos to scan !
customer_reviews.author: pcob

customer_reviews.title: Best thing since sliced bread.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and easy to use. Just what I needed to copy all the old family photos I have. Saves so much time. Every home should have one.
customer_reviews.author: "mr_t89"

customer_reviews.title: Ease of use
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant, all our photos scanned. Great way to save older photos
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner
customer_reviews.text: 300DPI is a matter of seconds 600DPI is slightly longer, but a great scanner overall I would definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: P Sinclair

customer_reviews.title: Best gadget ever
customer_reviews.text: I have scanned a huge number of prints in record time. Tweaking exposure and colour balance is extremely easy and saving is a doddle. Would thoroughly recommend and for the money I doubt it can be beaten
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Brinkworth

customer_reviews.title: scanner
customer_reviews.text: yes its easy to use takes about 10 seconds to scan a 6x4 print at 600 dpi, down side for me you have to stop and save images every 12 scans
customer_reviews.author: Ian P.

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Pleased with outcome . Quick and easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Anglican

customer_reviews.title: Good Product if Pricey
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup, very quick scan at std. resolution. Perfect for scanning lots of old photos. Good quality build.
customer_reviews.author: nicfad

customer_reviews.title: Plustek Photo Scanner Z300
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for digital downloading of those old stored photographs. Quality is excellent with the added ability to restore faded photographs. Researched a lot of products on the market before deciding on this product. Not dissapointed. The added bonus is that it is so easy to use and covers a wide range of photo sizes.
customer_reviews.author: clifford weston

customer_reviews.title: Excellently value photo scanner
customer_reviews.text: I used easily for the very rapid scanning of thousands of photoprints very successfully.
customer_reviews.author: Richard brownlow-Davies

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy to set up and use..
customer_reviews.text: Really good for quick scanning of large collections of photos.
customer_reviews.author: PJW

customer_reviews.title: Scans very quickly - ideal for multiple items etc.
customer_reviews.text: 30 years of photos lying in albums in a box in the loft - now all scanned and digitised in files - dead easy!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Milligan

customer_reviews.title: So quick.
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly what I was after. Very simple to use and really quick. Great buy if you want to digitise a large collection of photographs.
customer_reviews.author: S M.

customer_reviews.title: It's good
customer_reviews.text: It's good for scanning all manner of paper based items
customer_reviews.author: peterit

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Rapid results. Copied hundreds of old photographs in two or three days.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard Denham

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly
customer_reviews.text: The parcel arrived i read the manual downloaded the drivers and it worked perfectly. Just done get too excited in putting the documents through
customer_reviews.author: HLA

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner
customer_reviews.text: Great machine got loads and loads of photos can scan in seconds
customer_reviews.author: Godfrey Alan Jones

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up but it takes a few atempts to learn how to insert your photographs straight and even
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to install and pretty straightforward to operate. I wish it had included its own photo album for labeling purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Simmydog

customer_reviews.title: Superb piece of kit A+++
customer_reviews.text: The best bit of kit I have bought in a long time. Simple set up and absolutely rapid performance at 300 dpi . Slightly slower at 600 dpi .
customer_reviews.author: Ian Munro

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Simple and fast to use. Massive editing suite if you’re into that
customer_reviews.author: STEVEN RUSH

customer_reviews.title: does exactly what it says on the tin
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and setup, perhaps the the software could be improved a little. Overall very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: I. Titley

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what it is supposed to do very well and efficient.
customer_reviews.author: terence bramley

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: Very happy. Quick and easy to use for both the scanning and photo editing.
customer_reviews.author: KG

customer_reviews.title: Very fast picture scanning
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up. Takes up very little space and gets through photos very rapidly. Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel D.

customer_reviews.title: Really good photo copies with less effort and fuss
customer_reviews.text: This is a really great product and saves a lot of time from the original photo copier
customer_reviews.author: A K garrard

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use and excellent results
customer_reviews.text: This was so easy to set up and made scanning photos so quick and easy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.text: I bought the scanner to convert a box of old photos to digital to save space. It scans these really quickly so fully meets my expectations.

product_meta.title: Plustek Photo Scanner - ephoto Z300, Scan 4x6 Photo in 2sec, Auto Crop and Deskew with CCD Sensor. Support Mac and PC
feature_bullets: The easiest way to scan photos and documents. Supports 3x5, 4x6, 5x7, and 8x10 in sizes photo scanning but also letter and A4 size paper.
Fast and easy, 2 seconds for one 4x6 photo and 5 seconds for one 8x10 size photo. You can easily convert about 1000 photos to digitize files in one afternoon and share with your family or friends.
More efficient than a flatbed scanner. Just insert the photos one by one and then scan. This makes ePhoto much more efficient than a flatbed scanner.
Powerful Image Enhancement functions included. Quickly enhance and restore old faded images with a click of the mouse. Advanced editing functions are also available when needed.
ePhoto Z300 works with both Mac and PC : Supports Windows 7/8/10 , Mac OS X 10.8.x to 10.15.x . User can download the latest version on Plustek website
